verses.verse: And he commanded<WH6680> the steward of his house<WH1004>, saying<WH559>, Fill<WH4390> the men<WH582>'s sacks<WH572> with food<WH400>, as much as<WH834> they can<WH3201> carry<WH5375>, and put<WH7760> every man<WH376>'s money<WH3701> in his sack<WH572>'s mouth<WH6310>.

And put<WH7760> my cup<WH1375>, the silver<WH3701> cup<WH1375>, in the sack<WH572>'s mouth<WH6310> of the youngest<WH6996>, and his grain<WH7668> money<WH3701>. And he did<WH6213> according to the word<WH1697> that Joseph<WH3130> had spoken<WH1696>.
As soon as the morning<WH1242> was light<WH215>, the men<WH582> were sent away<WH7971>, they and their asses<WH2543>.

And when they were gone out<WH3318> of the city<WH5892>, and were not yet far off<WH7368>, Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> unto his steward<WH1004>, Up<WH6965>, follow<WH7291> after<WH310> the men<WH582>; and when thou dost overtake<WH5381> them<WH559>, say unto them<WH7999>, Wherefore have ye rewarded evil<WH7451> for good<WH2896>?
Is not this that in which my lord<WH113> drinketh<WH8354>, and whereby he indeed<WH5172> divineth<WH5172>? ye have done evil<WH7489> in so doing<WH6213>.
And he overtook<WH5381> them<WH1696>, and he spake unto them these<WH428> words<WH1697>.
And they said<WH559> unto him<WH1696>, Wherefore speaketh my lord<WH113> such words<WH1697> as these<WH2486>? Far be it from thy servants<WH5650> that they should do<WH6213> such a thing<WH1697>.

Behold <WH3701>, the money, which we found<WH4672> in our sacks<WH572>' mouths<WH6310>, we brought again<WH7725> unto thee out of the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667>: how then should we steal<WH1589> out of thy lord<WH113>'s house<WH1004> silver<WH3701> or gold<WH2091>?
With whomsoever of thy servants<WH5650> it be found<WH4672>, let him die<WH4191>, and we also will be my lord<WH113>'s bondmen<WH5650>.
And he said<WH559>, Now also let it be according unto your words<WH3651>: he with whom it is found<WH4672> shall be my bondman<WH5650>; and ye shall be blameless<WH5355>.
Then they hasted<WH4116>, and took down<WH3381> every man<WH376> his sack<WH572> to the ground<WH776>, and opened<WH6605> every man<WH376> his sack<WH572>.
And he searched<WH2664>, and began<WH2490> at the eldest<WH1419>, and left<WH3615> off at the youngest<WH6996>: and the cup<WH1375> was found<WH4672> in Benjamin<WH1144>'s sack<WH572>.
Then they rent<WH7167> their clothes<WH8071>, and laded<WH6006> every man<WH376> his ass<WH2543>, and returned<WH7725> to the city<WH5892>.
And Judah<WH3063> and his brethren<WH251> came<WH935> to Joseph<WH3130>'s house<WH1004>; and he was yet there<WH5307>: and they fell before him<WH6440> on the ground<WH776>.
And Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> unto them<WH4639>, What deed is this that ye have done<WH6213>? know ye<WH3045> not that such a man<WH376> as I can indeed<WH5172> divine<WH5172>?

And Judah<WH3063> said<WH559>, What shall we say<WH559> unto my lord<WH113>? what shall we speak<WH1696>? or how shall we clear ourselves<WH6663>? God<WH430> hath found out<WH4672> the iniquity<WH5771> of thy servants<WH5650>: behold<WH113>, we are my lord's bondmen<WH5650>, both we<WH1571>, and he also in whose<WH834> hand the cup<WH1375> is found<WH4672>.

And he said<WH559>, Far be it<WH2486> from me that I should do<WH6213> so<WH2063>: the man<WH376> in whose hand<WH3027> the cup<WH1375> is found<WH4672>, he shall be my bondman<WH5650>; but as for you<WH5927>, get you up in peace<WH7965> unto your father<WH1>.

Then Judah<WH3063> came near<WH5066> unto him<WH559>, and said, Oh<WH994>, my lord<WH113>, let thy servant<WH5650>, I pray thee<WH1696>, speak a word<WH1697> in my lord<WH113>'s ears<WH241>, and let not thine anger<WH639> burn<WH2734> against thy servant<WH5650>; for thou art even as Pharaoh<WH6547>.
My lord<WH113> asked<WH7592> his servants<WH5650>, saying<WH559>, Have<WH3426> ye a father<WH1>, or a brother<WH251>?

And we said<WH559> unto my lord<WH113>, We have<WH3426> a father<WH1>, an old man<WH2205>, and a child<WH3206> of his old age<WH2208>, a little one<WH6996>; and his brother<WH251> is dead<WH4191>, and he alone is left<WH3498> of his mother<WH517>; and his father<WH1> loveth him<WH157>.
And thou saidst<WH559> unto thy servants<WH5650>, Bring him down<WH3381> unto me<WH7760>, that I may set mine eyes upon him<WH5869>.
And we said<WH559> unto my lord<WH113>, The lad<WH5288> cannot<WH3201> leave<WH5800> his father<WH1>: for if he should leave<WH5800> his father<WH1>, his father would die<WH4191>.
And thou saidst<WH559> unto thy servants<WH5650>, Except<WH3808> your youngest<WH6996> brother<WH251> come down<WH3381> with you<WH3254>, ye shall see my face<WH6440> no more<WH7200>.
And it came to pass when we came up<WH5927> unto thy servant<WH5650> my father<WH1>, we told<WH5046> him the words<WH1697> of my lord<WH113>.
And our father<WH1> said<WH559>, Go again<WH7725>, buy<WH7666> us a little<WH4592> food<WH400>.

And we said<WH559>, We cannot<WH3201> go down<WH3381>: if our youngest<WH6996> brother<WH251> be<WH3426> with us<WH3381>, then will we go down; for we may<WH3201> not see<WH7200> the man<WH376>'s face<WH6440>, except<WH369> our youngest<WH6996> brother be with us<WH251>.
And thy servant<WH5650> my father<WH1> said<WH559> unto us<WH3045>, Ye know that my wife<WH802> bare<WH3205> me two sons<WH8147>:
and the one<WH259> went out<WH3318> from me<WH559>, and I said, Surely<WH2963> he is torn in pieces<WH2963>; and I have not seen him<WH7200> since<WH2008>:
and if ye take<WH3947> this one also from<WH5973> me<WH6440>, and harm<WH611> befall him<WH7136>, ye will bring down<WH3381> my gray hairs<WH7872> with sorrow<WH7451> to Sheol<WH7585>.
Now therefore when I come<WH935> to thy servant<WH5650> my father<WH1>, and the lad<WH5288> is not with us<WH5315>; seeing that his life is bound up<WH7194> in the lad<WH5315>'s life;

it will come to pass<WH7200>, when he seeth that the lad<WH5288> is not with us<WH4191>, that he will die: and thy servants<WH5650> will bring down<WH3381> the gray hairs<WH7872> of thy servant<WH5650> our father<WH1> with sorrow<WH3015> to Sheol<WH7585>.

For thy servant<WH5650> became surety<WH6148> for the lad<WH5288> unto<WH5973> my father<WH1>, saying<WH559>, If I bring<WH935> him not unto thee<WH2398>, then shall I bear the blame to my father<WH1> for ever<WH3117>.
Now therefore<WH5650>, let thy servant, I pray thee<WH3427>, abide instead of the lad<WH5288> a bondman<WH5650> to my lord<WH113>; and let the lad<WH5288> go up<WH5927> with his brethren<WH251>.
For how<WH349> shall I go up<WH5927> to my father<WH1>, if the lad<WH5288> be not with me<WH7200>? lest I see the evil<WH7451> that shall come on<WH4672> my father<WH1>.
